clinical_study.brief_title: Phase Ib/II Study of MEDI4736 Evaluated in Different Combinations in Metastatic Pancreatic Ductal Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib and II Open-Label, Multi-Center Study of MEDI4736 Evaluated in Different Combinations in Patients With Metastatic Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase Ib and II Open-Label, Multi-Center Study of MEDI4736 Evaluated in Different Combinations in Patients with Metastatic Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase Ib and II open-label, multi-center study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacodynamics, and antitumor activity of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy and novel anticancer agents in patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). This study will consist of 2 independent cohorts.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the first treatment cycle for each patient (28days from 1st dose)
primary_outcome.description: To assess the safety and tolerability of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy agents

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until confirmed disease progression or death
primary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069 in terms of objective response rate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until confirmed disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy and AZD5069 and investigate the relationship between PD-L1 expression and efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until confirmed disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy and AZD5069 and investigate the relationship between PD-L1 expression and efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until confirmed disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy and AZD5069 and investigate the relationship between PD-L1 expression and efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of antidrug antibodies(ADAs) for MEDI4736
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until 6 months after last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the immunogenicity of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069
To assess the peak concentration of MEDI4736 and the combination of MEDI4736 plus AZD5069, and MEDI4736 plus nab-paclitaxel+ gemcitabine
Through concentration of MEDI4736 and the combination of MEDI4736 plus AZD5069, and MEDI4736 plus nab-paclitaxel+ gemcitabine

secondary_outcome.measure: DoR, DCR, PFS, PFS3, and PFS6 in all patients using Investigator assessments according to RECIST 1.1, OS, OS6 and OS12
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To further assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 and AZD5069 in terms of DoR, DCR, PFS, PFS3, PFS6, OS, OS6 and OS12

secondary_outcome.measure: Presense of ADA's for MEDI4736 (Confirmatory Results: Positive or negative; tiers)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From data of first treatment until confirmed disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the immunogenicity of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of MEDI4736/ AZD5069 in blood and noncomparemental PK parameters (such as peak concentration and trough, as data allow, sparse sampling)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until confirmed progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of MEDI4736 and the combination of MEDI4736 and AZD5069

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until confirmed diseases progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy and AZD5069 and investigate the relationship between PD-L1 expression and efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first treatment until death
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with chemotherapy and AZD5069 and investigate the relationship between PD-L1 expression and efficacy of MEDI4736 in combination with AZD5069

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Adverse Events as a measure of safety and tolerability of AZD5069 in combination with MEDI4736
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline and throughout treatment up until 3 months after last dose
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety and tolerability profile of AZD5069 in combination with MEDI4736; vital signs (blood pressure, pulse, weight); laboratory parameters (clinical chemistry, haematology, urinalysis); physical examination; electrocardiograms (ECGs)

arm_group.description: MEDI4736 in combination with nab-paclitaxel + gemcitabine chemotherapy regimen via IV infusion
MEDI4736 via IV infusion and oral AZD5069

intervention.intervention_name: MEDI4736 in combination with nab-paclitaxel and gemcitabine
intervention.description: MEDI4736 in combination with nab-paclitaxel + gemcitabine chemotherapy regimen via IV infusion
MEDI4736 via IV infusion and oral AZD5069

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: -
1. Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic PDAC, no more than 1 prior chemotherapy regimen or treatment-naïve patients
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group 0 or 1
3. At least 1 lesion, not previously irradiated, that can be accurately measured at baseline as ≥10 mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes, which must have short axis ≥15 mm) with computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan and that is suitable for accurate repeated measurements
4. MEDI4736 + nab-paclitaxel + gemcitabine chemotherapy cohort: treatment-naïve patients with metastatic PDAC who have received no previous systemic chemotherapy 5 MEDI4736 + Cohort: Patient should receive no more than 1 prior chemotherapy regimen or any other systemic therapy for recurrent/metastatic PDAC
6. Life expectancy ≥ 12 weeks. 7. ECOG PS of 0 or 1 8. Adequate organ and bone marrow function
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any concurrent chemotherapy, investigational product , biologic, or hormonal therapy for cancer treatment.
2. Receipt of last dose of an approved anticancer therapy within 21 days prior to the first dose of study treatment
3. Major surgical procedure within 21 days prior to the first dose of IP.
4. Patients weighing less than 30 kg
5. History of leptomeningeal carcinomatosis
6. Ascites requiring intervention
7. Any unresolved toxicity NCI CTCAE Grade ≥2 from previous anticancer therapy
8. Current or prior use of immunosuppressive medication within 14 days of first dose
9. Brain metastases or spinal cord compression.
10. Medi4736+AZD5069 Cohort only: received any potent and moderate cytochrome CYP3A4 inhibitors, potent and moderate CYP3A4 inducers, P-gp substrates, BCRP substrates, sensitive CYP2B6 substrates, warfarin and coumarin derivatives, or herbal supplements within 14 days of the first dose of study treatment
11. Uncontrolled intercurrent illness
12. Other malignancy within 5 years except for noninvasive malignancies
13. Mean QT interval ≥470 ms
14. Active infection
15. Receipt of live attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to the first dose of IP
16. Female patients who are pregnant or breastfeeding, or male or female patients of reproductive potential who are not employing an effective method of birth control
17. Prior exposure to immune-mediated therapy
18. Known allergy or hypersensitivity to IP formulations or to other human monoclonal antibodies

overall_official.affiliation: Beatson Institute, University of Glasgow, Garscrube Estate, Switchback Rd. Glasgow, UK, G61 1BD

clinical_study.keyword: Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma, PDAC, immunotherapy, PDL1, AZD5069, MEDI4736
